name: df-pnrm
body: |- wceq(cpnrm, crab(s0, cnrm, wss(cfv(ccld, cv(s0)), crn(cmpt(s1, co(cv(s0), cmap, cn), cint(crn(cv(s1))))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ PNrm = { s0 ∈ Nrm |(Clsd ` s0)⊆ ran((s1 ∈(s0[↦]ℕ)↦ ⋂ ran(s1)))}
comment: Define perfectly normal spaces. A space is perfectly normal if it is normal and every closed set is a G_δ set, meaning that it is a countable intersection of open sets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Aug-2015.)
